ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_women] RP Server in Test
ygData.msgSnippet: Kelly Flock was interviwed by Edge Magazine and it seems he said things like ... Re: customer input .. if we listen to the customer they just fuck us up (his
ygData.messageBody:
Kelly Flock was interviwed by Edge Magazine and it seems he said things like
...

Re: customer input .. if we listen to the customer they just fuck us up (his
f-word not mine).

Re: customers .. we're just worried they have a valid credit card number

The quotes do NOT appear on the electronic digest at edge, article here
http://www.edge-online.co.uk/news_main.asp?news_id=3596

But they are in the full print version and were posted to Lums (before it
closed) and another mailing list and verified by some other folks. If you
know any Brits get them to scan the article and fax it. ;)

Here is another report based on that
http://www.thxinfo.com/article.php?sid=110

As an Aussie friend would say about it "Oi! Oi!" ;)

Hmmm .. may want to contact you Ice on the server that guild is on after
release. That is the team my daughter and I want to try. I want to be a
Saracen - as my husband has historical ties to Moorish culture in Spain and
that got me going on background ideas. That and they have NO elves! ;)

- Lora / Hechicera

-----Original Message-----
From: Christina [mailto:tina@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 02, 2001 6:59 PM
To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EQ_women] RP Server in Test



What comments?

- Christina

On Tue, 2 Oct 2001, Lora Roa wrote:

> Thats a thought, my daughter wants to go back to EQ but just to fool
around
> low level when we feel like it.
>
> I have quit AO too now. Had promise, assuming they made some of thier
> better ideas actually work. Instead, it seem like they broke more each
> patch than they fixed with the exception of major crashed (they have fixed
> most, but not all). Half my AO guild is going to try DAoC, and a few EQ
> people I know.
>
> However, recent Sony/Verant comments to a British gaming mag have me very
> hesitant about reopening an EQ account at all. :(
>
> - Lora/Hechicera
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: judy3t@... [mailto:judy3t@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 02, 2001 4:24 PM
> To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EQ_women] RP Server in Test
>
>
> For the RP lovers out there that have quit playing EQ, the new RP server,
> Firiona Vie, is up and running in test (i.e., you have to use eqtst.exe to
> play). They have new rules: trivial loot, race/class/deity alignments
that
> prohibit grouping and guilding with non aligned players, language barriers
> (no
> common tongue at all), everyone is ROLEPLAY ON, and only one character is
> allowed.
>
> I played it the last two nights and had a BLAST! Everyone in Everfrost
> (never
> did play Shaman past 9 before) was roleplaying. I hear that wasn't the
case
> in GFay and Qeynos but that the RP'ers were pretty strong and insistent
and
> the spam quieted down. The chars will be wiped out once the server goes
> live,
> but I kind of like Katrice and will probably keep her. I love the Shaman
> potions they can make now :-)
>
> A few powergamers have decided to come to FV to see how the new rules
affect
> people, and as long as they don't uber guild the server and camp the
dragons
> and make the high end game SUCK I don't mind.
>
> Anyway, the rumor is the server goes live the day DAoC is released. I'm
> planning on getting DAoC, but I may just not cancel my EQ account quite
yet.
> AO, on the other hand, BIG YAWN! Made it to 10 and quitting. Good try,
but
> the game is just too buggy *sigh*.
>
> Ice
>
